channel.title: Custom Made Chestplate
channel.description:
Hey guys, i made a chestplate that i worked on when i felt like modelling, probably spent about 3+ hours all up, this was made from scratch no pre-drawn picture to trace or anything (besides using a male model for shape). it can still be coloured but idk what colours to use. anyway tell me what you think: P.S fairly new to modelling, only modelled a few swords in the past
[IMG]http://i62.tinypic.com/25s6c2f.jpg[/img]

item.title: Custom Made Chestplate
item.dc:creator: @Coldmedicine Coldmedicine
item.description:
@Coldmedicine wrote:

Please add my skype: Waddafoock

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Made Chestplate
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

me n u 4ever:

Yea, the poly count isn’t too nice, about 1500, but if i were to ever put it in game for actual use, im sure i could clean it up to about 1000 (with a few detail sacrifices). I was planning on making a set, however it will be over time. i only model when i feel like it. Thanks for the feedback

That is a harsh amount for sure, by the looks of it the clean up wouldn’t be too bad and you wouldn’t have to change the detail too much. I understand, i’m the same way but the end result is something to look forward to.

i had one idea in mind for it being frost dragon armour

That would be most suitable, i reckon give the palette a try because it’d probably suit it the best.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Made Chestplate
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

me n u 4ever:

Yea, the poly count isn’t too nice, about 1500, but if i were to ever put it in game for actual use, im sure i could clean it up to about 1000 (with a few detail sacrifices). I was planning on making a set, however it will be over time. i only model when i feel like it. Thanks for the feedback

TBH just putting it in game alone will cause you to sacrifice some details. So you lowering the poly’s won’t be too bad, in terms of it rendering in game.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Made Chestplate
item.dc:creator: @me_n_u_4ever me n u 4ever
item.description:
@me_n_u_4ever wrote:

[quote=“Eyeownyew, post:2, topic:548963”]In my opinion this looks incredible

Really impressive if you’ve only modeled a few things before[/quote]
thanks heaps, the feedback really motivates me. yea i’ve only moddelled a few swords and edited existing models (extending on them).
i can show you some of them if you would like

Basically what eyeownyew said. Add some color and that thing is ready to go. You could make it a god colored body.

Zammy colors always looked cool (black/red or) imo


i might consider doing that.
actually early on, when i hadn’t finished making it, i made it a light icy blue. It looked quiet nice and because the thorns and everything i had one idea in mind for it being frost dragon armour
If you use meta change the obj smoothing to 120, it makes it look a little nicer.

The only issue i have is the poly, can you upload the wireframe? Try figure out a name for the item and then select the palette from there, it helps if you’ve a basis for the model. Have you also considered making a set for this? Furthering the idea could promising. Great work, keep it up.


Yea, the poly count isn’t too nice, about 1500, but if i were to ever put it in game for actual use, im sure i could clean it up to about 1000 (with a few detail sacrifices). I was planning on making a set, however it will be over time. i only model when i feel like it. Thanks for the feedback

Read full topic
